Package camzup.core

Class Mesh2

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.EntityData
camzup.core.Mesh
camzup.core.Mesh2
All Implemented Interfaces:
IEntityData, IMesh, ISvgWritable, IUtils, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Face2>
public class Mesh2
extends Mesh
implements java.lang.Iterable<Face2>, ISvgWritable
Organizes data needed to draw a two dimensional shape using vertices and faces. Given that a mesh is primarily a collection of references, it is initialized with null arrays (coordinates, texture coordinates and indices). These are not final, and so can be reassigned.

    Transforms all coordinates in the mesh permanently by a transform.

    Not to be confused with the temporary transformations applied by a mesh entity's transform to the meshes contained within the entity.

    Useful when consolidating multiple mesh entities into one mesh entity.

      public Vec2[] coords
      An array of coordinates in the mesh.

    • texCoords

      public Vec2[] texCoords
      The texture (UV) coordinates that describe how an image is mapped onto the geometry of the mesh. Typically in the range [0.0, 1.0].

    • DEFAULT_POLY_TYPE

      public static final Mesh2.PolyType DEFAULT_POLY_TYPE

      public Mesh2​(int[][][] faces, Vec2[] coords, Vec2[] texCoords)

      coords - the coordinates array
      texCoords - the texture coordinates array

  • Method Details

    • bevelCorner

      public Mesh2 bevelCorner​(int faceIdx, int vertIdx, float fac)
      Bevels a corner of a face in the mesh. The factor interpolates from the corner to the midpoint of an edge. For line segments of unequal length joined at a corner, the cut will be uneven. Uses Chaikin's corner cutting method.

      This leaves the old corner in the mesh's data in case the corner is used by other faces.
      Parameters:
      faceIdx - the face index
      vertIdx - the vertex index
      fac - the factor
      Returns:
      the new faces

    • bevelCorners

      public Mesh2 bevelCorners​(int faceIdx, float fac)
      Bevels all corners of a given face in the mesh. The factor interpolates from the corner to the midpoint of an edge. For line segments of unequal length joined at a corner, the cut will be uneven. Uses Chaikin's corner cutting method.

      This leaves the old corner in the mesh's data in case the corner is used by other faces.
      Parameters:
      faceIdx - the face index
      fac - the factor
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • bevelCorners

      public Mesh2 bevelCorners​(int faceIdx, float fac, int itr)
      Bevels all corners of a given face in the mesh.
      Parameters:
      faceIdx - the face index
      fac - the factor
      itr - the number of iterations
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • calcUvs

      public Mesh2 calcUvs()
      Calculates texture coordinates (UVs) for this mesh. Finds the object-space dimensions of each coordinate, then using the frame as a reference for new UVs, such that the shape acts as a mask for the texture (or, the texture fills the shape without repeating).
      Returns:
      this mesh
      See Also:
      calcDimensions(Mesh2, Vec2, Vec2, Vec2), Vec2.div(float, Vec2, Vec2)

      public Mesh2 clean()
      Removes elements from the coordinate, texture coordinate and normal arrays of the mesh which are not visited by the face indices.
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • insetFace

      public Mesh2 insetFace​(int faceIdx)
      Insets a face by calculating its center then easing from the face's vertices toward the center by 0.5.
      Parameters:
      faceIdx - the face index
      Returns:
      the new face indices

    • insetFace

      public Mesh2 insetFace​(int faceIdx, float fac)
      Insets a face by calculating its center then easing from the face's vertices toward the center by the factor. The factor is expected to be in the range [0.0, 1.0] . When it is less than 0.0, the face remains unchanged; when it is greater than 1.0, the face is subdivided by center.
      Parameters:
      faceIdx - the face index
      fac - the inset amount
      Returns:
      the new face indices

    • insetFaces

      public Mesh2 insetFaces()
      Insets all faces in the mesh once.
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • insetFaces

      public Mesh2 insetFaces​(int itr)
      Insets all faces in the mesh for a given number of iterations by a factor of 0.5 .
      Parameters:
      itr - the iterations
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • insetFaces

      public Mesh2 insetFaces​(int itr, float fac)
      Insets all faces in the mesh for a given number of iterations by a factor in the range [0.0, 1.0] .
      Parameters:
      itr - the iterations
      fac - the inset factor
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • reframe

      public Mesh2 reframe​(Transform2 tr)
      Centers the mesh about the origin, (0.0, 0.0) and rescales it to the range [-0.5, 0.5] . Emits a transform which records the mesh's center point and original dimension. The transform's rotation is reset.
      Parameters:
      tr - the output transform
      Returns:
      this mesh
      See Also:
      calcDimensions(Mesh2, Vec2, Vec2, Vec2)

    • reverseFace

      public Mesh2 reverseFace​(int i)
      Flips the indices which specify a face. Changes the winding of a face from counter-clockwise (CCW) to clockwise (CW) or vice versa.
      Parameters:
      i - face index
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • subdivFace

      public int[][][] subdivFace​(int faceIdx)
      Subdivides a convex face. Defaults to center-based subdivision.
      Parameters:
      faceIdx - the face index
      Returns:
      the new face indices

    • subdivFaceCenter

      public int[][][] subdivFaceCenter​(int faceIdx)
      Subdivides a convex face by calculating its center, cutting each of its edges once to create a midpoint, then connecting the midpoints to the center. This generates a quadrilateral for the number of edges in the face.
      Parameters:
      faceIdx - the face index
      Returns:
      the new face indices

    • subdivFaceFan

      public Mesh2 subdivFaceFan​(int faceIdx)
      Subdivides a convex face by calculating its center, then connecting its vertices to the center. This generates a triangle for the number of edges in the face.
      Parameters:
      faceIdx - the face index
      Returns:
      the new face indices

    • subdivFaceInscribe

      public Mesh2 subdivFaceInscribe​(int faceIdx)
      Subdivides a convex face by cutting each of its edges once to create a midpoint, then connecting them. This generates peripheral triangles and a new central face with the same number of edges as the original. This is best suited to meshes made of triangles.
      Parameters:
      faceIdx - the face index
      Returns:
      the new face indices

    • subdivFaces

      public Mesh2 subdivFaces()
      Subdivides all faces in the mesh once.
      Returns:
      this mesh

      Parameters:
      itr - iterations
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • subdivFacesCenter

      public Mesh2 subdivFacesCenter​(int itr)
      Subdivides all faces in the mesh by a number of iterations. Uses the center method.
      Parameters:
      itr - iterations
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • subdivFacesFan

      public Mesh2 subdivFacesFan​(int itr)
      Subdivides all faces in the mesh by a number of iterations. Uses the triangle-fan method.
      Parameters:
      itr - iterations
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • subdivFacesInscribe

      public Mesh2 subdivFacesInscribe​(int itr)
      Subdivides all faces in the mesh by a number of iterations. Uses the inscription method.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      this mesh

    • toOrigin

      public Mesh2 toOrigin​(Transform2 tr)
      Centers the mesh about the origin, (0.0, 0.0), by calculating its dimensions then subtracting the center point. Emits a transform which records the mesh's center point. The transform's rotation and scale are reset.
      Parameters:
      tr - the output transform
      Returns:
      this mesh
      See Also:
      calcDimensions(Mesh2, Vec2, Vec2, Vec2), translate(Vec2)

    • transform

      public Mesh2 transform​(Transform2 tr)
      Transforms all coordinates in the mesh permanently by a transform.

      Not to be confused with the temporary transformations applied by a mesh entity's transform to the meshes contained within the entity.

      Useful when consolidating multiple mesh entities into one mesh entity.
      Parameters:
      tr - the transform
      Returns:
      this mesh

      the arc

    • arc

      public static Mesh2 arc​(float startAngle, float stopAngle, float oculus, int sectors, Mesh2.PolyType poly, Mesh2 target)
      Creates an arc from a start and stop angle. The granularity of the approximation is dictated by the number of sectors in a complete circle. The thickness of the arc is described by the annulus. Useful where sectors may be faster than the Bezier curves of Curve2.arc(float, float, float, camzup.core.ArcMode, Curve2) or where there is an issue rendering strokes.
      Parameters:
      startAngle - the start angle
      stopAngle - the stop angle
      oculus - the size of the opening
      sectors - number of sectors in a circle
      poly - the polygon type
      target - the output mesh
      Returns:
      the arc

    • proximity

      public static java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Float,​Vert2> proximity​(Mesh2 m, Vec2 p)
      Returns a collection of mesh vertices organized by their proximity to a point. The proximity is expressed as a factor where the nearest vertex is on the nearBound; the farthest is on the farBound.
      Parameters:
      m - the mesh
      p - the point
      Returns:
      the collection

    • proximity

      public static java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Float,​Vert2> proximity​(Mesh2 m, Vec2 p, float nearBound, float farBound)
      Returns a collection of mesh vertices organized by their proximity to a point. The proximity is expressed as a factor where the nearest vertex is on the nearBound; the farthest is on the farBound. Any function which mutates a vertex's properties by such a factor can be applied to the collection.

      However, the Euclidean distance from a point is unsigned, so two points may have approximately the same distance from the point yet be in different quadrants of the Cartesian coordinate system, i.e. not organized by proximity to each other.
      Parameters:
      m - the mesh
      p - the point
      nearBound - the factor near bound
      farBound - the factor far bound
      Returns:
      the collection
      See Also:
      getVertices(), Vec2.distSq(Vec2, Vec2)

    • ring

      public static final Mesh2 ring​(float oculus, int sectors, Mesh2 target)
      Creates a regular convex polygon with an opening in its center. The oculus describes the relative size of this opening.
      Parameters:
      sectors - the number of sides
      oculus - the size of the opening
      target - the output type
      Returns:
      the ring

    • ring

      public static final Mesh2 ring​(float oculus, int sectors, Mesh2.PolyType poly, Mesh2 target)
      Creates a regular convex polygon with an opening in its center. The oculus describes the relative size of this opening. When the polygon type is Mesh2.PolyType.QUAD, the ring will be composed of quadrilaterals; otherwise, triangles.
      Parameters:
      oculus - the size of the opening
      sectors - the number of sides
      poly - the polygon type
      target - the output type
      Returns:
      the ring

    • tracePerimeter

      public static Mesh2 tracePerimeter​(Mesh2 source, int count, float offset, Mesh2 target)
      Traces the perimeter of each face of the source mesh. Returns a target mesh where all faces have the number of vertices specified by the count; each face will be inscribed within the source face, where the target vertices lie on an edge of the source. The perimeter is treated as a percent in the range [0.0, 1.0] , so, for example, a square face's corners will occur at 0.0, 0.25, 0.5 and 0.75 .
      Parameters:
      source - the source mesh
      count - the number of vertices
      offset - the factor offset
      target - the output mesh
      Returns:
      the traced mesh

    • triangle

      public static final Mesh2 triangle​(Mesh2 target)
      Creates a triangle.
      Parameters:
      target - the output mesh
      Returns:
      the triangle

    • uniformData

      public static Mesh2 uniformData​(Mesh2 source, Mesh2 target)
      Restructures the mesh so that each face index refers to unique data, indifferent to redundancies. As a consequence, coordinate and texture coordinate are of equal length and face indices are easier to read and understand. Useful for making a mesh similar to those in Unity or p5. Similar to 'ripping' vertices or 'tearing' edges in Blender.
      Parameters:
      source - the source mesh
      target - the target mesh
      Returns:
      the mesh
